author: Sabine Hossenfelder
description:
Check out courses in science, computer science, and mathematics on Brilliant! Get your first 30 days free as well as 20% off an annual premium subscription when you use my link ➜ https://brilliant.org/sabine.

For decades, researchers have assumed that qualia – each person’s subjective experiences – can’t be measured. Indeed, the idea of qualia has long been thought to be outside of science. But a few weeks ago, a group of researchers went and measured qualia for the first time. Let’s take a look at what this means for consciousness research.

Paper: https://www.cell.com/iscience/fulltext/S2589-0042(25)00289-5

title: Scientists Measure Qualia for First Time – It was thought to be impossible
